sentences.english: Many times brides were very young girls and, therefore, small in stature.
sentences.chinese: 许多新娘都是非常年轻的小姑娘，所以，身材也娇小。

sentences.english: One of the charming little Loves is already fairly spitted.
sentences.chinese: 在那些娇小可爱的爱神中，已有一个被注射器扎通了。

sentences.english: Thirty-three years old, Rizzoli was a small and square-jawed woman.
sentences.chinese: 她今年三十三岁，身材娇小，下巴宽大。

sentences.english: The screen door on the main building sprang open, and a short, slender woman appeared.
sentences.chinese: 主楼的纱门敞开着，一位娇小玲珑的女人出现在眼前。

sentences.english: Her little white hands are fluttering like doves that fly to their dovecots.
sentences.chinese: 她那双白皙娇小的手，如正展翅归巢的鸽子。

sentences.english: Plants usually small with thin stolons.
sentences.chinese: 植物通常娇小，匍匐茎纤细。

sentences.english: Delicately built and slim, she had a gypsy beauty about her.
sentences.chinese: 她娇小玲珑，有吉卜赛人的美。

sentences.english: The women of the south are diminutive, subservient and very polite.
sentences.chinese: 南方的妇女娇小可爱，毕恭毕敬，很有礼貌。

sentences.english: Again, I saw that figure small and young.
sentences.chinese: 又见那身影，娇小而蹁跹。

sentences.english: Brandishing a tiny bosom may be a reaction to that trend.
sentences.chinese: 炫耀娇小的胸部也许正是对这种潮流的回应。

sentences.english: Indeed, before T. rex hit the scene, tyrannosaurs were relatively petite.
sentences.chinese: 在霸王龙出现之前，暴龙类的成员是比较娇小的一群。

sentences.english: Soft pastel natural colors are the true reflection of the beauty of these petite flower girls.
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔自然的颜色是这些娇小花童的真实写照。

sentences.english: The tiny gnome peered over the railing into the secluded Dalaran courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 娇小的侏儒透过栏杆端详着魔法罩下的达拉然。

sentences.english: I was tall ands she was petite.
sentences.chinese: 我个子高，她则身材娇小。

definition: sweet, fair, and graceful (of a woman)/a seductive woman/secluded (bower)
